sourceMeaningMnemonic: The kanji <kanji>two</kanji> and the radical <radical>two</radical> are the exact same things. Therefore, you know the kanji for two already!
meaningInfo: More simply put, you can just know that this kanji is the double of One. It's two lines, that's not all that hard to remember!
readingMnemonic: Think of all the things you have <kanji>Two</kanji> of. What is the most important? Some would say eyes, some would say ears. I would say the <reading>knee</reading> (<ja>に</ja>) because if you didn't have them, it'd be really hard to go up stairs.
readingInfo: Imagine yourself without two knees, and see what it would be like. What would give you trouble? What couldn't you do? Just imagining this for a minute or two will help you to remember the reading of this kanji more effectively.
